text: Authorization Server is a service located on the platform and the Access Token generated from the server is sent back to the client from the platform. To enable the Authorization Server, refer to the following steps: Examine the authorization-server.properties file and ensure that all the relevant parameters and values are set correctly. The authorization-server.properties file exists in both the platform and execution container paths at $MZ_HOME/etc/authorization-server/authorization-server.properties . The system will use the respective file depending on whether the Authorization Server is running on the platform or execution container. If you are using file-based as storage, you do not need to manually create the folder as specified in storage.file-based.storage-location , as it will be automatically created during platform startup. See Authorization Server Properties for an example of the parameters. Startup the platform or execution container (depending on the configuration) to enable the Authorization Server. Startup the platform Startup the execution container To enable the https for Authorization Server, see HTTP Encryption .
title: Enabling Authorization Server - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
